sub_title: Programme Manager at International Child Development Initiatives (ICDI)
summary:
"Change the world by being yourself." - Amy Poehler
As a firm believer in Amy Poehler's inspiring words, I am committed to making a positive impact on the world by leveraging my skills, abilities, and knowledge. My journey in life and my professional career revolve around the pursuit of a better, more equitable world for all. With a passion for social change and a deep-rooted commitment to tackling social inequalities, I have found my purpose in advocating for early childhood, children's rights and well-being, social protection, and women's empowerment.

I hold an MA in Social Work, specializing in Social Projects and more than 8 years of experience within the humanitarian/development/philanthropy sphere have equipped me with a comprehensive understanding of the challenges faced by communities around the world. My education has been a driving force in guiding my career towards meaningful and impactful work.

My ultimate goal is to contribute to building a better world where every individual has equal opportunities and access to essential resources. Through my work, I aspire to create a ripple effect of positive change that reaches far and wide, touching the lives of those in need.

Passionate about personal and professional growth, I am continuously seeking new opportunities to expand my knowledge and skillset. My strong organizational skills and goal-oriented mindset ensure that I remain focused on achieving impactful results.

Let's collaborate to drive transformational change and together, create a more just and compassionate society.

Objective: Improve eating habits in children. 
Through a summer camp that included workshops on education, motivation, awereness and play, we promoted healthy eating habits for kids.

projects.title: Promoting Healthier Eating Habits
projects.description:
Thesis Project: 
- Designed and implemented a project to improve the overall diet and eating habits of Mother’s participating in the Food Bank of Monterrey’s program; through healthier food choices, physical activity and self-care. It was developed and implemented using the Logical Framework Methodology.

contributors.headline: Programme Manager at International Child Development Initiatives (ICDI)

courses.name: Early Childhood Development with emphasis on Neuroscience

profile_positions.description:
- Coordination of ICDI's programmes and projects in Central America. Focusing on Child Protection, Child Labour and Child Development. 
- Design, draft, develop and acquire new projects and consultancies;
- Provide technical support and training;
- Monitor and evaluate projects: Administrative and financial support of ongoing projects.This include preparation of qualitative and quantitative reports such as projects highlights, financial reports, theoretical framework, inputs for annual report and social media. 
- Active follow up with partners and stakeholders.

About ICDI: 
We are an organisation focused on psychosocial development of children and young people growing up in difficult circumstances. ICDI believes in the power of children and young people, supporting their rights and addressing the underlying causes for the problems they face. 

We aim to improve policies and practices by building the skills of: children, mothers, fathers, caregivers, families, communities, local organizations, and authorities. ICDI also works with and for bigger international children's rights organizations, supporting knowledge transfer through training, research, and advice.  
https://icdi.nl/
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Analyzed and assessed projects with a focus on Early Childhood Development in Latin American communities.
- Prepared and reviewed qualitative and quantitative reports including projects highlights, financial reports, theoretical framework and inputs for annual report.
- Research, analysis and documentation of monitoring and evaluation of current and past projects.
- Administrative support of ongoing projects to effectively achieve desired results and maximize social benefit, such as, capture and update of relevant information, monitor budget proposals, track donations, prepare information for the board meetings.
- Active follow up with partners and stakeholders.
- Research and analyze new proposals and organizations to assure that they meet the requirements.
- Collaborated in the planning and activation of the 2nd Symposium of ECD; with Jack Shonkoff as keynote speaker. 

About FEMSA Foundation:
At FEMSA Foundation we have contribute to achieve social value through our social investment strategy. We have two areas of focus: water and early childhood development. 
https://fundacionfemsa.org/ 

In Early Childhood Development area, we have the vision that children between 0 – 5 years reach their full potential and transform their communities. We are convinced that the first years of life have a decisive impact on the trajectory of our children. We must ensure that all children have optimal conditions and stimulating environments, even before birth.
profile_positions.title: Early Childhood Education Programs at FEMSA Foundation

company.name: Alianza de Ministerios de Misericordia, A.C. (AMMAC)

profile_positions.company: Alianza de Ministerios de Misericordia, A.C. (AMMAC)
profile_positions.description:
- Assessed and maintained ongoing social projects within four lines of intervention: nutrition, health, housing and education.

1. Saturday School: With this project we were looking to reinforce the weekly classes that the children have and teach them that they can learn in a fun way and install in them the love of study so that they can have a better future. Our objective was to decrease the school dropout that is so common in these vulnerable schools. We focused our classes in the English subject but we also taught different subjects such as: Spanish, Math, Art, among others. I coordinated this project and some of my responsibilities were: develop the curricula, coordinate with the school’s director and teachers, establish agreements for our work in their schools, find new schools to implement the project, organize volunteers and students to implement the project. Monitoring and delivering results to directors and parents. 

2. Mercy for all: the objective of this project is to distribute perishable and non-perishable food to families living in vulnerable communities. My main role was to coordinate students and volunteers so they could benefit from this experience. 

3. My house is your house: This project benefits indigenous groups and vulnerable families in Nuevo Leon that do not have the resources to build their own homes. My role was to coordinate national and foreign volunteers. 

- Designed and implemented a project to empower young girls through researching female and spreading that knowledge to other girls.  
- Led the national and foreign volunteered program.
profile_positions.title: Social Projects and Volunteers Coordinator

- Coordinated volunteered activities.

volunteer_experiences.description:
- Analysis and assessment of social programmes and projects in the field of Early Childhood Education and Care (ECEC)
- Review of narrative and financial reports. 
- Developing of tools and instruments relevant for projects and trainings. 
- Research, analysis and documentation of current projects. 
- Administrative support of ongoing projects, such as, capture relevant information, presentations for meetings, research for new proposals, among others.

- Held nutrition workshops applying the Foundation’s methodology of constructivism. 
- Gave a lecture on health and nutrition to Junior High School Students. 

About Alfa Foundation: http://www.alfa.com.mx/RS/community.htm
